channel.title: Port is Open, Server is Online, Yet I can't connect?
channel.description:
Hi mopar
So I am currently running a 718 server through my VPS which has been online for a while and has no connections problems.
I recently decided to open up a 317 (multi-world server) and the ports are open with the server running, but I can't seem to connect no matter what I do. I've made sure all of the world IP's and ports are correct, yet I'm still receiving a "world is offline" message.
And again, I've checked the ports and they are open for the IP address. And I can connect to the server If I host it from my localhost computer but when I move to the VPS I can't connect to the IP.
And yes, I added an inbound/outbound connection rule for the ports.
[img]http://i.imgur.com/jzqZygp.png[/img]
And yeah it says it's online ^^ So idk.

item.title: Port is Open, Server is Online, Yet I can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

[quote=“Zailyx, post:10, topic:550820”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=669732.msg4478518#msg4478518 date=1427844900]

First of all, this isn’t my live VPS IP, I have multiple.
Secondly, yes it is run on the same server as my 718, and it is bound to seperate ports.
718 - 43594
317 w1 - 43595
317 w2 - 5555
relay world server - 5557

Are the clients connecting to the proper ports as well?
Like the 317 w1 is connecting to 43595 and etc.
[/quote]

And yes of course. Like I said this all works on a local client and when connecting locally from 0.0.0.0, however I can’t connect extenally[/quote]
Could your computer be blocking the connection to the vps?

Try going into the RS2LoginProtocolDecoder (or a file of similar name) and adding a System.out.println message (can be anything) in the login method (So. the code that is reading the username from the input stream and etc). Check to see if the server recieves the connection by attemting to login, and if there is a connection it will print your message.

If nothing prints, then one of the machines is blocking the connection before it can get to the server, or it’s not making it’s way to the VPS.

If it does print, but you still cannot connect, there is something in the server blocking your connection.
You should look at the magic id (Both server and client sided), along with the UID and client version. To start.

Read full topic
item.source: Port is Open, Server is Online, Yet I can't connect?

[/quote]
I doubt it, to be honest.[/quote]

Just because most of this community is under 18, jobless, and can’t afford a proper dedicated server with proper protection doesn’t mean I can’t

item.title: Port is Open, Server is Online, Yet I can't connect?
item.dc:creator: @Zailyx Zailyx
item.description:
@Zailyx wrote:

First of all, this isn’t my live VPS IP, I have multiple.
Secondly, yes it is run on the same server as my 718, and it is bound to seperate ports.
718 - 43594
317 w1 - 43595
317 w2 - 5555
relay world server - 5557

And third, the only thing someone can “attempt” to do to me with an IP address is find the location of my VPS servers, try to DDoS me (Goodluck I have 100gbps DDoS mitigation), or attempt to hack me (also Goodluck with that lol).

Oh and also, if you want to find someone’s IP, it takes almost an entire minute.

item.dc:creator: @sk8rdude461 sk8rdude461
item.description:
@sk8rdude461 wrote:

Are you running your 317 on the same VPS as your 718?
Cause if so, you need to bind one of them to 5555, and the other 43594.
